guide.helpDesc: AVL trees use rotations to stay balanced. You can trigger them by dragging nodes:
guide.helpRightDesc: Pulling a node right brings its **Left Child** up. Use this when the left side is too heavy.
guide.helpLeftDesc: Pulling a node left brings its **Right Child** up. Use this when the right side is too heavy.

wiki.title: AVL Encyclopedia
wiki.conceptDesc:
The core of an AVL tree is maintaining a strict **Balance Factor (BF)**. For any node `n`:

- `H(L)`: Height of the left subtree
- `H(R)`: Height of the right subtree
- **Formula:** `BF(n) = H(L) - H(R)`

**Rule:** A node is balanced if `|BF(n)| â‰¤ 1`. If `|BF| > 1`, a rotation is mandatory.
wiki.bfRule:
When `|BF| > 1`, the tree is skewed:
- **BF > 1**: Left-heavy.
- **BF < -1**: Right-heavy.
wiki.deletionDesc: After deleting a node, all ancestors must be checked. During deletion, a rotation might be required even if a child's BF is 0.
wiki.caseLLDesc: BF=2, Left Child BF â‰¥ 0. Fix with **[Right Rotate]**.
wiki.caseRRDesc: BF=-2, Right Child BF â‰¤ 0. Fix with **[Left Rotate]**.
wiki.caseLRDesc: BF=2, Left Child BF = -1. Fix: **[Left Rotate]** child, then **[Right Rotate]** parent.
wiki.caseRLDesc: BF=-2, Right Child BF = 1. Fix: **[Right Rotate]** child, then **[Left Rotate]** parent.

tutorial.title: AVL Masterclass
tutorial.welcome: Welcome to the AVL Masterclass! Learn self-balancing step-by-step.

l1.title: Concept: Tree Height
l1.desc:
Height is defined as the number of edges on the longest path to a leaf (Leaf Height = 0).

ðŸ‘‰ **Task:** Click on any node with **Height = 2**.

l2.title: Concept: Balance Factor (BF)
l2.desc:
AVL trees use **Balance Factor** to detect imbalance.
Formula: `BF = Height(Left) - Height(Right)`.

ðŸ‘‰ **Task:** Calculate the BF of the **highlighted node**.

l3.title: Practice: LL Case (Guided)
l3.desc:
When the left side is heavy and straight (BF=2, Child BF=1), it's an LL Case.
This time, watch where **Node 40 (inner subtree)** moves after rotation!

l4.title: Challenge: Basic Rotation
l4.desc:
No more hints!
Observe the RR shape and fix it. Pay attention to the movement of **Node 30**.

l5.title: Practice: Double Rotation (Guided)
l5.desc:
Zig-Zag shapes (LR or RL) need two steps: Straighten the child first, then rotate the parent.

ðŸ‘‰ **Task:** Follow instructions to fix this tree.

l6.title: Challenge: Double Rotation
l6.desc:
The final test. System won't tell you if it's LR or RL.

ðŸ‘‰ **Task:** Identify the shape and fix the tree!

l7.title: Final: Deletion & Rebalance
l7.desc:
Deletion can also cause imbalance.

ðŸ‘‰ **Task:** Select **Node 10**, DELETE it, and then fix the tree.
